Game has always been a classic and is always fun to go back to and let out some rage. I think everyone should try this game at least.

Lo recomiendo en su totalidad. El juego es uno de los mejores sin duda y más allá de la jugabilidad que posee el modo online es la mejor parte. Es un sitio donde podrás conocer a muchas personas de distintos lugares y con los cuales estoy segura que pasarás horas y horas de juego; las risas, enojos, tristeza y depresión hahaha siempre estarán ahí y es lo que hace a este juego especial.
Hasta el momento no me canso de jugarlo y dudo que un momento lo haga. Puede que actualmente no haya mucha gente en los servidores pero solo es cuestión de buscar para encontrar… porque de alguna manera siempre habrá alguien.

Instant classic! Love the story and gameplay. The UI commentary is hilarious and the community is great. Since the first time ive played it on Xbox 360 I loved the game and even decided to get it on PC to enjoy more Left 4 Dead filled hours!

When people bring up Left 4 Dead 1, there's always that one person who foolishly says "What's the point? All of the content is already in L4D2!"

These people fail to realize how inferior the Versus scoring system is in the sequel. 

In Left 4 Dead 2, scoring is almost entirely weighted towards distance from the saferoom, with a very small survivor bonus depending on how many people make it inside the saferoom at the end, and another really small tie breaker that goes by how much damage each team dealt as infected. That's it, that's the scoring system in Left 4 Dead 2. On paper this sounds reasonable enough, but in practice, it leads to teammates leaving each other behind and absolutely sprinting towards the saferoom, because who cares if you let someone die since it barely effects the score, especially if they're close to the saferoom.

This is NOT the case in Left 4 Dead 1, and the scoring system is superior at every angle.

First, there is a health bonus, which is weighted extremely heavily towards your final score. This means taking hits from infected matters, and you and your team must work together carefully to ensure everyone takes the least damage possible. If all 4 survivors make it to the saferoom, but they have red health and no healing items, it could be just as detrimental to the score as losing 2 of the survivors but making it to the end with green health, despite the survivor bonus, which is also much more brutal in this game.

The survivor bonus multiplies your final score by the number of players who survive. So if your score is, say 400, and all 4 survivors make it to the saferoom, that's 400 x 4, coming out to 1,600 (without also calculating health bonus for simplicity). If only 3 make it, it would be 400 x 3, except it would ALSO lower the overall health bonus because one of your teammates is, well, dead. 
Compare this to the sequel, where each survivor in the saferoom adds a measly 25 points, and it's no wonder teamwork is much more scarce in that game.

In Left 4 Dead 1, teamwork is a NECESSITY. You cannot just leave someone behind because that severely puts a dent in your score. But teamwork goes both ways.

See, in Left 4 Dead 2, maps are designed in a way to encourage instakills from the Charger, or hang people off ledges with the jockey. In Left 4 Dead 1, you had Smoker, Boomer, Hunter, and of course, Tank. This raised the skill ceiling by making instakills only possible by either hitting a survivor off a high ledge with a tank, or very careful teamwork between the Smoker and Hunters, with the Boomer backing up the others by disorienting the survivors. This allowed for the same level of cautiousness that Valve seemed to aim for in Left 4 Dead 2, but kept things feeling fair, even if you do die. Because to die in Left 4 Dead 1 versus means either your team made a mistake or the other team is good and killed you using creative tactics. 

For the competitive players, I will always, STRONGLY recommend Left 4 Dead 1 over 2. However, if you're into simple campaign or you're into modding, then Left 4 Dead 2 might be your preferred choice. I believe both games are great, but Left 4 Dead 1 got less things wrong than the sequel.

Fajna, przyjemna rozgrywka, dość dużo rodzajów broni, wiele rozbudowanych lokacji oraz wiele innych ciekawych i często przydatnych przedmiotów do walki z zombiakami. Jednym z nich jest np: koktajl mołotowa, który jak rzuci się w dużą ilość zombiaków, to potrafi naprawdę wiele zdziałać. A poza tym to ciężko znaleźć jakiś większy minus, gra praktycznie idealna w swoim gatunku.

A estas alturas es muy difícil que nadie conozca esté clásico de Valve. En pleno año 2020 sigue siendo un título muy activo, por el cual es muy fácil poder encontrar partidas en línea. La poca variedad de enemigos y armas, como así también la falta de ciertas acciones (combate cuerpo a cuerpo), se compensan gracias a una jugabilidad adictiva. Eso sí, es recomendable disfrutarlo con amigos.
